abstract: JPMorgan Chase uses annual investor day to fend off growing inquiries about whether nation's largest bank would be more profitable if it were broken up; executives insist that bank benefits from its breadth and scale, despite extra regulatory costs that are set to take effect and which are likely to hit JPMorgan harder than competitors.
lead_paragraph: Faced with regulations that will raise its costs, JPMorgan spent investor day highlighting the ways it would not get any bigger — and would be better off remaining whole.

headline.main: JPMorgan Chase Insists It’s Worth More as One Than in Pieces
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Chase Insists It’s Worth More as One Than in Pieces

snippet: Faced with regulations that will raise its costs, JPMorgan spent investor day highlighting the ways it would not get any bigger — and would be better off remaining whole.
